timeline.bodyText: since this isn't dependent on the hive supported statistics at all, I would list out supported statistics here rather than calling getSupportedColumnStatistics.
timeline.author: rschlussel

timeline.bodyText: This function will be very similar to getSupportedColumnStatistics, replace throwing error with return ImmutableSet.of(TOTAL_SIZE_IN_BYTES);
timeline.author: viczhang861

timeline.message:
Change getSupportedColumnStatistics for temp table

- Hive does not support all presto types, but temporary table supports
storing unsupported presto types via native format. Hence, directly
calling metastore.getSupportedColumnStatistics() to determine supported
column statistics for each column will cause problems for temporary
tables.

timeline.bodyText: we can also do non-nulls by default.
timeline.author: rschlussel

timeline.message:

calling metastore.getSupportedColumnStatistics() to determine supported
column statistics for each column will cause problems for temporary
tables.

timeline.bodyText: I don't think this is a reliable way to know if something is a temporary table, since technically any table can start with that prefix
timeline.author: rschlussel

replies.bodyText: You can use Table::PrestoTableType to check temporary table.
replies.author: viczhang861
pguofb

timeline.bodyText:
nit  // default    is enough
or keep names same using TOTAL_SIZE_IN_BYTES and NUMBER_OF_NON_NULL_VALUES
timeline.author: viczhang861

Change getSupportedColumnStatistics for temp table

- Hive does not support all presto types, but temporary table supports
storing unsupported presto types via native format. Hence, directly

timeline.bodyText: is this never called for temporary tables?
timeline.author: rschlussel

replies.bodyText: Yeah, this is never called for temporary tables. This is only called by AnalyzePlan.
replies.author: pguofb
